availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Andrew Cunningham (Trigg Co, Ky, farmer and prov govt)

body.p: Trigg County, Kentucky, farmer and provisional government convention member. Virginia native. Son of William Cunningham and Nancy P. Pool Cunningham in Trigg County, Kentucky, on January 9, 1833. Father of G. Cunningham, B. Cunningham, M. Cunningham, Eliza Cunningham, Joseph Cunningham. Owned one enslaved person in Trigg County, Kentucky, in 1840. Owned ten enslaved persons in Trigg County in 1850. Farmer in Trigg County in 1860. Owned eleven enslaved persons in Trigg County in 1860. Member of the convention of the provisional government held at Russellville in November 1861.

ab.bibl:
Sixth Manuscript Census of the United States (1840), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Trigg County, p. 249.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Trigg County, District 2, p. 279.

Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Trigg County, p. 379A-B.

Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Trigg County Marriages, Film #000321335, p. 44.
KYR-0004-033-0001.
